stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the overworld hub, reorganising empty terrain, assigning entrances for several secret "mechanic" mini-levels (rainbow slide, cloud-cap, wing-cap, minecart, pinball). He also reports a successful private beta of Course 6 and discusses emulator support fixes.

development_findings.summary: Private beta test of Course 6 ran "super well" earlier the same day.
development_findings.quote: I've had a beta test of course six running today and it went super well.

development_findings.summary: RTYI failed on the popular Parallel Launcher emulator; Kaze collaborated with the maintainer and produced a fix a week before the demo, but the update was never pushed to users, leaving many unable to play.
development_findings.quote: A week before the RTYI demo released I fixed it with the guy that maintains Parallel Launcher and then the update didn't get pushed out.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 is the primary tool for exporting new levels into the Mario 64 decompilation.
development_findings.quote: This is Fast 64, it lets me export my level into more 64 decompilation.

development_findings.summary: Kaze wants the forthcoming static recompilation build to ship with RTYI to avoid emulator/plugin issues.
development_findings.quote: This is why I want the recompilation to release with the [game].

development_findings.summary: Large empty stretch in overworld (Part 10/11 area) is filled by a new "rainbow slide" secret level, accessed after sponsoring an athlete Yoshi with coins. Decision made live; mechanic doubles as coin sink.
development_findings.quote: For rainbow slides, there is an athlete Yoshi... After he's fully trained, he… jumps into the fucking moon. Then you're at the rainbow slide level.

development_findings.summary: Planned suite of small, single-mechanic side levels (cloud-cap, wing-cap, minecart, pinball, etc.). Each estimated at "half a day" of work; scope-creep actively monitored.
development_findings.quote: All of these side levels will be super quick to produce. They all will just take like a day at most.

development_findings.summary: Mario’s model is being finalised: cap-bounce animation and shadow effects still missing; Kaze expects to finish later that day.
development_findings.quote: I was about to finalize Mario's model too… I have to add back his cap falling up and down when he jumps.

development_findings.summary: Map screen will eventually display remaining overworld stars per area to help players track progress.
development_findings.quote: I think we should also have something that tells you how many stars you're missing in each overworld part on the map screen.

development_findings.summary: F3 showcase event tentatively targeted for 19 July; Kaze weighing first-time sponsorship to fund it.
development_findings.quote: What do you guys think of July 19th for F3? … F3 has always been a non-sponsored event, but sponsors are so fucking lucrative.

context_findings.summary: Future direction depends on RTYI’s success; Kaze may pivot to original commercial games or even open a studio producing both romhacks and retail titles if revenue permits.
context_findings.quote: If I make 20 million dollars off of RTYI I'm opening a game studio … develop real games that were also fan games at the same time.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expects RTYI to be a monetary loss when accounting for salaries (e.g., Biobak) because YouTube/Patreon income is largely independent of the hack.
context_findings.quote: RTYI is going to be a net negative after I pay Biobak.

context_findings.summary: Nintendo has removed 71 of his videos; Kaze views their strategy as petty and designed to avoid challenging the legal grey area of patch distribution.
context_findings.quote: They know we can't touch you here so we're gonna touch you here.

context_findings.summary: Shows personal life snippets: two 300-litre aquariums, feeding fish watermelon; casual chat about anime dislike and nuclear-power ‘psy-ops’.
Expresses frustration with emulator bugs and DMCA takedowns but also excitement over new level ideas and community events.

biobak.summary: Salary noted in budget discussion; gives design feedback in chat, warning about over-use of coin-gated interactions and scope creep.
biobak.quote: Coin-gate interactions are perfectly fine, but you need variety.

zeina.summary: Appears on stream (phone rings, looks at fish) but no direct development input captured.

key_stories.title: Nintendo’s DMCA takedowns
key_stories.summary: Nintendo has repeatedly removed Kaze’s YouTube videos containing Mario IP. He contests some successfully, but 71 remain offline.
key_stories.challenge: Visibility of RTYI and other hacks suppressed by copyright claims.
key_stories.process: Fights individual takedowns, adjusts content strategy.
key_stories.outcome: Ongoing; believes Nintendo targets videos because patches are a legal grey area.
key_stories.key_quote: Do you know how famous I would be if Nintendo didn't constantly take my videos down?

key_stories.title: Parallel Launcher compatibility fix
key_stories.summary: RTYI originally crashed on the community’s favourite emulator. Kaze co-developed a patch days before the public demo.
key_stories.challenge: Game unplayable for a large emulator user base.
key_stories.process: Debugged with emulator maintainer; issued fix.
key_stories.outcome: Update never propagated, leading to launch-day confusion; Kaze frustrated.
key_stories.key_quote: It was all around a shit show.

key_stories.title: Filling the overworld dead zone
key_stories.summary: A large, empty stretch in the hub felt dull. Live brainstorming led to the ‘athlete Yoshi’ sponsorship quest unlocking a rainbow slide level.
key_stories.process: Considered deleting land, cave level, cloud-cap level; settled on coin-sponsored Yoshi idea.
key_stories.outcome: Design locked; requires ruler markings and Yoshi NPC scripting.
key_stories.key_quote: After he's fully trained, he… jumps into the fucking moon.
